column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of CaAl2Si2 were synthesized via an argon arc-melt method19,22,32.
#Text=For compensation of possible loss of Ca, the starting weight of Ca was augmented by an excess of approximately 10 percent.
#Text=Samples, once synthesized, are stable in air over at least one year.

#Text=X-ray and neutron powder diffraction analyses (see SM) confirmed the stoichiometry as well as the single-phase structure with lattice parameters which are in excellent agreement with earlier reports19,22,32,33.
#Text=Two pressure cells were used for measuring a four-point DC magnetoresistance within 2 ≤ T ≤ 300 K and H ≤ 90 K.
#Text=One cell (up to 10 kbar) uses extraction naphtha as a pressure-transmitting fluid and a heavily doped bulk n-InSb single crystal as a pressure gauge.
#Text=On this cell, both transverse and longitudinal resistances were studied and, in addition, Hall voltage was measured under the same experimental conditions.
#Text=The second pressure cell (<30 kbar) uses Fluorinert and an extrapolated curve for pressure calibration; with this cell, only transverse resistivity was studied.
#Text=In all cases, phonon contribution to ρT,P is taken to be H-independent.
